modus_operandi: The fraudster gained unauthorised access to the customer's credit card account through a credential stuffing attack, using login credentials compromised in a separate third-party data breach. They then requested a new credit card for delivery to a 'mule address', likely authorising this with a generated One-Time Passcode, intending to intercept and activate it for fraudulent transactions.
description: Calculates the number of days since the last credit card (primary or replacement) was issued to the customer. A very low value (e.g., 0-7 days) indicates a recent card issuance, which can be an anomaly if the customer rarely requests new cards, or if it's a second request in an unusually short period.
